description.narrative: The IFC investment will support Vegpro Ghana (VGL or the Project), a Ghanaian company associated with Vegpro Kenya Limited (VKL or the Company), Kenyas largest vegetable producer, processor and exporter. The Project consists of: (1) setting up of a 1,070 hectares (ha) commercial farm to produce vegetables on land leased from the Government of Ghana on a 50-year renewable lease; (2) development of 768 ha equipped with 12 Centre Pivot Irrigation Systems each covering 64 ha; (3) procurement of farm equipment and refrigerated vehicles and (4) construction of a bespoke pack house on the farm for packing and processing vegetables for export to UK and EU markets.

The proposed Project will help a) create employment for up to 1500 people; b) develop the horticulture industry in Ghana; c) develop a network of suppliers of goods and services (inputs, transportation, maintenance; equipment, etc) which has industry-wide benefits; d) provide access to export market for 200 smallholder farmers which should improve their incomes and e) contribute to food security through the production of maize for the local market and increased incomes of employees and smallholders.
